humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma has two foci with maximum dimensions of 3.2 cm and 1.5 cm. Since the largest tumor size is 3.2 cm, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the pathologic T stage is T2. This assessment is made regardless of the type of carcinoma or the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS). The T stage is determined solely by the size of the largest tumor.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma has two foci with maximum dimensions of 3.2 cm and 1.5 cm. The T stage for invasive breast cancer is based on the size of the largest focus. Therefore, since the largest focus is 3.2 cm, the T stage is T2 (T2: tumor size > 2.0 cm and ≤ 5.0 cm).
